Package bomberman.controller

Class PlayerInputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • bomberman.controller.PlayerInputHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener
    public class PlayerInputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    This class handles the input by a player via keyboard.
    Author:
    Felix Bachmann

      PlayerInputHandler​(Player player, int keyCodeLeft, int keyCodeRight, int keyCodeUp, int keyCodeDown, int keyCodePlant)
      Creates a new input handler.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerInputHandler

        public PlayerInputHandler​(Player player,
                          int keyCodeLeft,
                          int keyCodeRight,
                          int keyCodeUp,
                          int keyCodeDown,
                          int keyCodePlant)
        Creates a new input handler.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to which the input will be redirected
        keyCodeLeft - the keyCode constant which is used for moving left
        keyCodeRight - the keyCode constant which is used for moving right
        keyCodeUp - the keyCode constant which is used for moving up
        keyCodeDown - the keyCode constant which is used for moving down
        keyCodePlant - the keyCode constant which is used for planting a bomb

    • Method Detail

      • updateFromPressedKeys

        public void updateFromPressedKeys()
        Invokes movement for hold keys.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent arg0)
        Invoked when a key is pressed. This key is added to the pressed keys, i.e. until the key is released movement may be invoked.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        arg0 - the event triggered by the pressed key

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent arg0)
        Invoked when a key is released. This key is removed from the pressed keys, i.e. no more movement for this key is invoked until pressed again.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        arg0 - the event triggered by the pressed key

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
